revised_title: Smallpox and Bloody Urine: A Case Study
tldr: This article discusses a case study of a young man who developed bloody urine during a smallpox infection. Despite the common belief that this symptom is a certain sign of approaching death, the patient recovered. The author, Pierce Dodd, shares his experience and the treatment he provided, which included the use of various medications and remedies.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Infectious Diseases
